N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 88.4 - Exhibit e-4: engineering justification

State Regulations
(a) The applicant shall: (1)
provide the engineering justification for
the proposed transmission line, showing its relation to the existing facilities
of the applicant and the interconnected network; (2)
indicate specific benefits with respect
to reliability and economy to the applicant and the interconnected
network; (3)
state the proposed
date for completion of the line and indicate the impact on the systems of the
applicant and others of failure to complete the proposed transmission line on
such date; and
(4)
provide
appropriate system studies, showing expected flows on the line under normal, peak and emergency conditions, including the system reliability impact study
forwarded by the Transmission Planning Advisory Subcommittee for approval by
the operating committee of the New York Independent System Operator, which
shows effects on stability of the interconnected system. Notes
